step1.sentence: We will hold a meeting on Friday to review the quarterly results.

step2.story: The team held a meeting to resolve the conflict between two members. The manager had prepared talking points, but the most productive part of the hour was ten minutes she had not planned — silence followed by an honest question nobody had thought to ask before.

step3.story: The organization held over two hundred meetings a year. An internal audit found that fewer than a third had clear outcomes, and fewer than half ended with agreed next steps. The operations lead proposed a simple protocol: every meeting needed a one-sentence purpose statement shared in advance, and every meeting ended with a written summary of decisions and actions. Adoption was slow at first. A year later, meeting duration had dropped by twenty percent and follow-through on decisions had increased significantly. The organization was holding fewer meetings and holding better ones.
